title: Psalms Chapter 112 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 112 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 112 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 112.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:1, who is blessed?
options: The man that feareth the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: The man that feareth the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:1 says, 'Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD, that delighteth greatly in his commandments.'

questions.question: What shall be mighty upon earth according to Psalms 112:2?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:2 states, 'His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 112:3: 'Wealth and riches shall be in his _____.'
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:3 reads, 'Wealth and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:4, what arises unto the upright in the darkness?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:4 states, 'Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 112:5 says a good man lendeth and sheweth favour.
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:5 reads, 'A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth.'

questions.question: What will the good man guide with discretion according to Psalms 112:5?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:5 says, 'he will guide his affairs with discretion.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:6, how long shall the righteous be in remembrance?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:6 states, 'the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 112:7 says the righteous shall be afraid of evil tidings.
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:7 states, 'He shall not be afraid of evil tidings; his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.'

questions.question: What is fixed according to Psalms 112:7?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:7 says, 'his heart is fixed, trusting in the LORD.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 112:8: 'His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his ____.'
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:8 reads, 'he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:9, to whom hath he given?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:9 states, 'He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor.'

questions.question: What shall the wicked do according to Psalms 112:10?
options: Be grieved and gnash with their teeth
questions.correctAnswer: Be grieved and gnash with their teeth
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:10 says, 'The wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 112:3 states that his righteousness endureth for ever.
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:3 reads, 'his righteousness endureth for ever.'

questions.question: What is exalted with honour according to Psalms 112:9?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:9 states, 'his horn shall be exalted with honour.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:4, which of the following is NOT a characteristic of the upright?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:4 says the upright 'is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.' Proud is not mentioned.

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 112 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 112 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Psalms 112:1 teach us about the importance of obedience in Christian living?
options: Blessed is the man who delights greatly in the LORD's commandments
Blessed is the man who has great wealth
Blessed is the man who is popular among friends
Blessed is the man who is physically strong
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed is the man who delights greatly in the LORD's commandments
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:1 states that blessing comes to those who fear the LORD and delight greatly in His commandments, emphasizing obedience and reverence as keys to a blessed life. This is reinforced by verses 2 and 3 which speak of the blessings on the generation of the upright and their lasting righteousness.

questions.question: A believer faces uncertainty about their future. Based on Psalms 112:7, what biblical truth can encourage them to trust God?
options: Do not be afraid of evil tidings; trust in the LORD with a fixed heart
Avoid all risks and stay in safe places
Work harder to secure your own future
Ignore troubling news and focus on personal plans
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be afraid of evil tidings; trust in the LORD with a fixed heart
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:7 encourages believers not to fear bad news because their hearts are fixed, trusting in the LORD. This teaches reliance on God rather than anxious self-reliance, a practical lesson for persevering through uncertainty (see also verses 6 and 8).

questions.question: What does Psalms 112:9 teach about generosity and its impact on a believer's reputation?
options: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his horn shall be exalted with honour
He keeps all his wealth to himself
He lends without expecting to help others
He ignores the needs of the poor
questions.correctAnswer: He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his horn shall be exalted with honour
questions.explanation: Verse 9 shows that generosity towards the poor results in honor and lasting righteousness, teaching believers that giving is a mark of true godliness and leads to respect and spiritual blessing. This aligns with verses 3 and 5 about righteousness and discretion.

questions.question: How does Psalms 112:4 describe the character traits of an upright person that believers should emulate?
options: Gracious, full of compassion, and righteous
questions.correctAnswer: Gracious, full of compassion, and righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:4 highlights that the upright person shines as light in darkness by being gracious, compassionate, and righteous—traits essential for reflecting God's love and moral integrity in daily life. Other verses like 5 and 9 further emphasize favor and generosity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:6, what assurance is given to the righteous regarding their legacy?
options: The righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance
The righteous will be forgotten quickly
The righteous will face constant defeat
The righteous will have no impact
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance
questions.explanation: Verse 6 promises that the righteous will not be moved and will be remembered forever, encouraging believers to live righteously with confidence that their godly life leaves a lasting legacy (supported by verses 2 and 3).

questions.question: What practical advice about managing affairs is given in Psalms 112:5?
options: A good man shows favor and lends, guiding his affairs with discretion
questions.correctAnswer: A good man shows favor and lends, guiding his affairs with discretion
questions.explanation: Verse 5 teaches believers to be generous and wise in managing their affairs, demonstrating godly stewardship and kindness in daily interactions, consistent with the themes of righteousness and generosity found throughout the chapter.

questions.question: How can Psalms 112:3 encourage believers in their work ethic and integrity?
options: Wealth and riches shall be in his house; his righteousness endureth forever
Rely on shortcuts to gain wealth quickly
Seek wealth by any means necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Wealth and riches shall be in his house; his righteousness endureth forever
questions.explanation: This verse links material blessing with enduring righteousness, encouraging believers to pursue honest work and integrity, trusting God will bless their efforts in a lasting way (also reflected in verses 2 and 9).

questions.question: A believer is tempted to despair over enemies. What does Psalms 112:8 teach about how to respond?
options: His heart is established; he shall not be afraid until he see his desire upon his enemies
Fear the enemies and avoid confrontation
Ignore the situation and hope it improves
questions.correctAnswer: His heart is established; he shall not be afraid until he see his desire upon his enemies
questions.explanation: Verse 8 teaches steadfastness and courage rooted in trust in God, encouraging believers to remain firm and confident until God brings about justice, aligned with the trust expressed in verses 7 and 6.

questions.question: What does Psalms 112:10 reveal about the fate of the wicked when witnessing the blessings of the righteous?
options: They will be grieved, gnash their teeth, and melt away
They will rejoice with the righteous
They will change their ways immediately
questions.correctAnswer: They will be grieved, gnash their teeth, and melt away
questions.explanation: Verse 10 describes the distress of the wicked in response to the righteous’ blessings, illustrating the ultimate victory of righteousness and the perishing desire of the wicked, complementing the theme of enduring righteousness in verses 3 and 9.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 112:2, the descendants of the upright will be weak and unblessed.
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:2 clearly states that the seed of the upright shall be mighty upon earth and blessed, emphasizing the positive generational impact of living uprightly.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 112:1 associates fear of the LORD with blessing and delight in His commandments.
questions.explanation: Verse 1 connects the fear of the LORD with blessings and delighting in His commandments, underscoring the foundation of godly living through reverence and obedience.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 112:4 says, 'Unto the upright there ariseth ______ in the darkness.'
questions.explanation: Verse 4 teaches that the upright bring light in darkness, symbolizing hope, guidance, and godly influence in difficult times, encouraging believers to be a positive witness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 112:5 encourage believers to balance generosity with wisdom?
options: A good man shows favor and lends; he guides his affairs with discretion
A good man gives blindly without thought
A good man never lends to anyone
A good man focuses only on saving money
questions.correctAnswer: A good man shows favor and lends; he guides his affairs with discretion
questions.explanation: Verse 5 highlights that generosity should be accompanied by wise management, teaching believers to be prudent stewards while serving others, consistent with righteousness and compassion.

questions.question: What does Psalms 112:6 teach about the stability of the righteous person?
options: Surely he shall not be moved forever
He will be shaken by every trial
He will live a short life
questions.correctAnswer: Surely he shall not be moved forever
questions.explanation: Verse 6 assures that the righteous are firmly established and will endure, encouraging perseverance and faithfulness in the Christian walk, linked to the everlasting remembrance mentioned in the same verse.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:9, what is a result of enduring righteousness combined with generosity?
options: His horn shall be exalted with honour
He will face dishonor and shame
He will be ignored by others
questions.correctAnswer: His horn shall be exalted with honour
questions.explanation: Verse 9 connects enduring righteousness and generous giving to honor and exaltation, teaching believers that godly character leads to respect and a good reputation.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 112 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 112.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:1, what is the character trait of the man who is blessed?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:1 states that blessed is the man who fears the LORD, indicating reverence and awe towards God as the source of blessing.

questions.question: What promise is made about the descendants of the upright in Psalms 112:2?
options: His seed shall be mighty upon earth
questions.correctAnswer: His seed shall be mighty upon earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:2 declares that the generation of the upright shall be blessed and mighty upon the earth, highlighting a lasting legacy.

questions.question: In Psalms 112:3, what two blessings are said to be in the house of the righteous?
questions.explanation: Verse 3 explicitly mentions wealth and riches in the house of the righteous, along with enduring righteousness, indicating material and spiritual blessings.

questions.question: Psalms 112:4 describes light arising in darkness for the upright. This is an example of which literary device?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'light in the darkness' metaphorically represents guidance and hope for the upright amid adversity, a common biblical motif.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:5, a good man shows favor and what else?
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states a good man shews favor and lends, reflecting generosity and wise management of affairs.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 112:6 says the righteous shall be moved and forgotten.
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:6 states the righteous shall not be moved forever and shall be in everlasting remembrance, opposite of being forgotten.

questions.question: What is the attitude of the righteous towards evil tidings as per Psalms 112:7?
questions.explanation: Verse 7 highlights the steadfast trust of the righteous in the LORD, making them unafraid of bad news.

questions.question: Psalms 112:8 uses the phrase 'his heart is established.' What does this signify in Hebrew thought?
questions.explanation: In Hebrew idiom, an 'established heart' denotes inner stability and confidence, as indicated in Psalms 112:8.

questions.question: What act of charity is attributed to the righteous in Psalms 112:9?
options: He hath given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: He hath given to the poor
questions.explanation: Verse 9 emphasizes the compassionate nature of the righteous, exemplified by giving to the poor.

questions.question: What happens to the wicked when they see the exaltation of the righteous according to Psalms 112:10?
options: They are grieved and melt away
questions.correctAnswer: They are grieved and melt away
questions.explanation: Verse 10 describes the wicked’s anguish and defeat upon witnessing the success of the righteous.

questions.question: The repeated theme of 'righteousness enduring forever' in Psalms 112 (verses 3 and 9) reflects which broader biblical concept?
questions.explanation: The enduring righteousness alludes to God’s everlasting covenant promises, a major theme in Scripture connecting Psalms 112 with covenant theology.

questions.question: Considering Psalms 112 as a wisdom psalm, which Old Testament book also frequently employs the concept of fearing the LORD as the start of wisdom?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 1:7 and other passages emphasize that 'the fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom,' linking Psalms 112 to wisdom literature.

questions.question: Which New Testament verse echoes the theme of light arising in darkness found in Psalms 112:4?
questions.explanation: John 1:5 states 'The light shines in the darkness,' paralleling the imagery of light for the upright in Psalms 112:4.

questions.question: The literary structure of Psalms 112 highlights a contrast between the righteous and the wicked. Which verses form this chiastic structure?
questions.explanation: Verses 1 and 10 bookend the psalm contrasting the blessed man who fears the LORD with the wicked who perish, demonstrating chiastic structure.

questions.question: How does the cultural context of ancient Near Eastern societies enhance the understanding of lending and generosity in Psalms 112:5?
options: Lending with favor was an act of social responsibility
questions.correctAnswer: Lending with favor was an act of social responsibility
questions.explanation: In the ancient Near East, lending without interest and showing favor was a key social virtue, reflecting wisdom and compassion as in Psalms 112:5.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 112 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 112 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:1, what characterizes the man who is blessed?
options: He feareth the LORD and delighteth greatly in His commandments
He is known for his wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: He feareth the LORD and delighteth greatly in His commandments
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:1 teaches that the man who is blessed is one who fears the LORD and finds great delight in His commandments. This aligns with Proverbs 9:10 which states that the fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and with Deuteronomy 10:12 that calls for fearing God and loving Him. It also echoes New Testament teaching in Acts 10:35 that God shows no partiality but accepts those who fear Him and do what is right.

questions.question: What is promised to the seed of the upright according to Psalms 112:2?
options: His seed shall be mighty upon earth
questions.correctAnswer: His seed shall be mighty upon earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:2 declares that the descendants of the upright man will be mighty on earth, which reflects the biblical theme of blessing upon the righteous lineage as seen in Genesis 17:7 and Psalm 1:3. This also ties into the promise to Abraham that his descendants would be numerous and blessed (Genesis 12:2-3) and the blessing of a godly heritage in Proverbs 20:7.

questions.question: In Psalms 112:3, what is said to endure forever in the house of the righteous?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:3 states that the righteousness of the upright endures forever, pointing to the lasting spiritual legacy over temporal riches. This is consistent with Isaiah 54:17 where righteousness is an everlasting protection, and 2 Corinthians 5:21 which speaks of righteousness imputed through Christ. The permanence of righteousness contrasts with fleeting earthly wealth (Matthew 6:19-20).

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:4, what arises unto the upright in darkness?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:4 states that light arises unto the upright in darkness, symbolizing God's guidance and presence in times of trouble. This theme is echoed in Isaiah 9:2, John 1:5 where Jesus is the Light of the world, and 2 Corinthians 4:6 where God's light shines in our hearts. The light reflects God's salvation and hope amidst spiritual darkness.

questions.question: What qualities does Psalms 112:4 attribute to the upright man?
options: Gracious, full of compassion, and righteous
questions.correctAnswer: Gracious, full of compassion, and righteous
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:4 describes the upright as gracious, compassionate, and righteous, reflecting God's own character as seen in Exodus 34:6-7 and Matthew 5:7. These traits are central to Christian ethics and mirror Jesus' ministry (Luke 6:36). They demonstrate the fruit of the Spirit (Galatians 5:22-23).

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:5, how does a good man manage his affairs?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:5 highlights that a good man guides his affairs with discretion, showing wisdom and prudence. This reflects Proverbs 3:21-23 which commands wisdom and discretion, and James 1:5 where believers are encouraged to seek God’s wisdom. Discretion is vital for godly stewardship and witness.

questions.question: What assurance does Psalms 112:6 give regarding the stability of the righteous?
options: He shall not be moved forever
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not be moved forever
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:6 promises the righteous will not be moved forever, indicating spiritual and eternal stability. This is consistent with Psalm 1:3 which describes the righteous as firmly planted trees, and Hebrews 12:28 which encourages steadfastness in faith. It assures believers of God’s sustaining power (Philippians 4:13).

questions.question: What does Psalms 112:7 say about the righteous man's attitude toward evil tidings?
options: He is not afraid because his heart trusts in the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: He is not afraid because his heart trusts in the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:7 reveals the righteous man is fearless in the face of evil tidings because his heart is fixed on trusting God. This trust echoes Proverbs 3:5-6 and Romans 8:28, where reliance on God brings peace. Jesus taught similar trust in Matthew 6:25-34.

questions.question: What does Psalms 112:8 say the righteous man will see upon his enemies?
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:8 indicates the righteous man will not fear until he sees his desire upon his enemies, implying divine vindication. This aligns with Psalm 37:34 about waiting on the LORD for justice and Romans 12:19 which instructs believers to leave vengeance to God. It affirms God’s sovereign judgment.

questions.question: According to Psalms 112:9, what has the righteous man done for the poor?
options: He hath dispersed and given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: He hath dispersed and given to the poor
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:9 highlights that the righteous man is generous to the poor, an essential aspect of righteousness consistent with Proverbs 19:17 and James 2:15-16. Jesus praised such generosity (Luke 6:38) and taught care for the needy as service to Him (Matthew 25:35-40).

questions.question: What is said about the horn of the righteous in Psalms 112:9?
options: His horn shall be exalted with honour
questions.correctAnswer: His horn shall be exalted with honour
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:9 uses 'horn' metaphorically for strength and honor, stating it will be exalted. This symbol of power appears in 1 Samuel 2:1-10 and Luke 1:69 where God's anointed receives strength. The exaltation of the righteous is a theme throughout Scripture, showing vindication by God (Psalm 18:2).

questions.question: How do the wicked react to the righteousness of the upright according to Psalms 112:10?
options: They are grieved, gnash their teeth, and melt away
questions.correctAnswer: They are grieved, gnash their teeth, and melt away
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:10 describes the wicked’s reaction to the success of the righteous as grief and frustration, which parallels Jesus’ description of such gnashing of teeth in Matthew 8:12 and Luke 13:28. This shows the ultimate failure of the wicked, consistent with Proverbs 24:19-20.

questions.question: What is the ultimate fate of the desire of the wicked as stated in Psalms 112:10?
options: The desire of the wicked shall perish
The desire of the wicked shall prosper
The desire of the wicked shall be fulfilled
The desire of the wicked shall be ignored
questions.correctAnswer: The desire of the wicked shall perish
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:10 concludes that the desires of the wicked will perish, affirming the biblical teaching that evil plans ultimately fail (Psalm 37:1-2, Proverbs 21:30). This is consistent with Romans 6:21 and Galatians 6:7, warning about the consequences of wickedness.

questions.question: Which of the following best summarizes the eschatological hope expressed in Psalms 112:6-8?
options: The righteous will be established forever, fearless, and will see the fulfillment of their desires over their enemies
The righteous will be persecuted and destroyed by their enemies
The righteous will hide in fear until the end of days
The righteous will be indifferent to their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous will be established forever, fearless, and will see the fulfillment of their desires over their enemies
questions.explanation: Verses 6-8 of Psalms 112 express that the righteous are eternally secure, fearless in adversity, and will ultimately triumph over enemies. This echoes New Testament promises of eternal security (John 10:28), fearless faith (1 John 4:18), and final victory (Revelation 21:7).

questions.question: How does Psalms 112:5 reflect biblical principles of stewardship and generosity?
options: A good man shows favor and lends, guiding his affairs with discretion
A good man hoards wealth and ignores others
A good man spends recklessly without planning
A good man depends solely on luck
questions.correctAnswer: A good man shows favor and lends, guiding his affairs with discretion
questions.explanation: Psalms 112:5 emphasizes generosity and prudent management, reflecting biblical stewardship principles (Luke 6:38, Proverbs 11:24). The call to lend and show favor aligns with the commands in Deuteronomy 15:7-8 and 2 Corinthians 9:6-7 to give cheerfully and wisely.
